column4: apparently sun-java6-jre package, the one that the article you sent me told me I had to install, doesn't exist (and yes, I have added the universe repository) and the closest one to it, "Sun Java 6.0 Plugin", is not available on my 64-bit machine.
it's not in the universe repository, read more closely :)
I don't know if it's hard to find the info in the link, but just read what ubottu said
oh, thanks, I was looking in the article.
if the article contradicts that and you have a spare minute, would be great if you added a note :)
when I try to reload my package information after adding the lucid partner, I get this error: http://paste.ubuntu.com/485137/
I did it with the Synaptic GUI in Settings > Repositories > Other Software.
hmm, not sure if that adds the gpg key, but I guess not
(you need to add the gpg key yourself)
what is the gpg key and how would I go about adding it?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories/Ubuntu#Authentication Tab is the closest I can get, but basically just use apt-key
so basically I should import the key file of the ubuntu lucid partner? And where does apt-key come in to play? :S
it's in the link I gave you
that adds the key to the keys apt should trust
Thank you, I was able to add the repository, I think. The packages are showing up now.
